DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Creatinine Result Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded yes/no/not applicable indicator related to a creatinine laboratory procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for creatinine, the breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.(NCI):Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is pre-study serum creatinine
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL OR calculated creatinine clearance (Cockroft-Gault formula) greater than or equal to 50 mL/min OR 24-hour urine creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance (CrCl) greater than or equal to 30 mL/min and less than 60 mL/min (Cockroft-Gault)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 X ULN OR Measured or calculated creatinine clearance (CrCl) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min for subject with creatinine levels greater than 1.5 X institutional ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to twice the upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL (less than or equal to 133 umol/L) OR calculated creatinine clearance (Cockroft-Gault formula) greater than or equal to 50 mL/min OR 24-hour urine creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 40 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min (if using the Cockcroft-Gault formula)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than 1.5 X institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min for patients with creatinine levels greater than or equal to 1.5 X institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m^2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine within normal institutional limits OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal or a calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min (Cockcroft-Gault method) for patients receiving combination of cisplatin and pemetrexed and greater than or equal to 45 mL/min for patients receiving pemetrexed?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min (if using the Cockcroft-Gault formula)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine within normal institutional limits OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine within normal institutional limits OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL using the modified Cockcroft-Gault formula?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine within normal institutional limits OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance (CrCl) greater than 50 mL/min using Cockroft-Gault equation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal or a calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 ml/min/1.73 m2 (Cockcroft-Gault method) for patients receiving combination of cisplatin and pemetrexed and greater than or equal to 45 ml/min/1.73 m2 for patients receiving pemetrexed?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL (less than or equal to 120 umol/L) OR calculated creatinine clearance (Cockroft-Gault formula) greater than or equal to 50 mL/min OR 24-hour urine creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine within normal institutional limits OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal 1.5 x upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 40 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than 1.5 X institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min for patients with creatinine levels greater than or equal to 1.5 X institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine within normal limits OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 (eGFR) for patients with creatinine levels above the upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine within normal institutional limits OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 29
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 2.0 mg/dL OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine within normal limits OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 (eGFR) appropriate to race for patients with creatinine levels above the upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min by either measured or calculated clearance?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than 2.5 x institutional upper limit of normal OR measured or calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min for patients with creatinine levels above 2.5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than 1.5 mg/dL (equal to 132 umol/L) OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 35
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m^2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 30
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 45 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 32
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 2.5 x institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 34
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 31
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than 1.0 X institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min for patients with creatinine levels greater than or equal to 1.0 X institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 37
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine within normal institutional limits for age OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 33
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal 1.5 x upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 36
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 38
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine below institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 40
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study BSA-Normalized creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 43
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine within normal institutional limits OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 42
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 45 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 39
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance, estimated GFR, greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73m2 (Cockcroft-Gault)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 47
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 40 mL/min based on either Cockroft-Gault estimate or based on urine collection (12 or 24 hours)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 44
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73m2 by Cockcroft-Gault?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 45
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x the upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min (if using the Cockcroft-Gault formula)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 46
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 45 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 50
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance (using the Cockcroft-Gault formula) greater than or equal to 45 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 52
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 me2 for patients with creatinine levels above 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 51
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to the institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 54
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 2.0 x institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 53
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance or radioisotope GFR greater than 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 by either Cockcroft- Gault formula or analysis normal serum creatinine based on age?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 48
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 55
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance by MDRD (CrCl) greater than 50 ml/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 58
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to the institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 by either Cockcroft-Gault formula or 24-hour urine collection analysis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 57
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional ULN  or creatinine clearance or radioisotope GFR greater than or equal to 70mL/min/1.73m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 56
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL OR calculated creatinine clearance (Cockroft-Gault formula) greater than or equal to 50 mL/min OR 24-hour urine creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 73
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 by Cockcroft-Gaul or creatinine less than 1.5 x upper limit of normal, within 2 weeks of randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 59
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN and concurrent creatinine clearance (CrCl) greater than or equal to 50mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine greater than 1.5 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 63
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN, or measured creatinine clearance (CrCl) greater than or equal to 45 mL/min as calculated by the Cockcroft-Gault method (confirmation of creatinine clearance is only required when creatinine is greater than 1.5 x institutional ULN)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 68
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with serum creatinine greater than 1.5 x higher than institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 62
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study BSA-Normalized creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 (using Cockcroft-Gault CrCl)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 65
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal 1.5 x upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 40 mL/min/1.73 m^2 (calculated using the CKD-EPI equation or Cockgroft-Gault formula) for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 72
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal 1.5 x upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 40 mL/min/1.73 m^2 (calculated using the CKD-EPI equation or Cockgroft-Gault formula) for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 64
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 74
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine within normal institutional limits OR calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 69
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above 1.5 x institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 70
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min (if using the Cockcroft-Gault formula)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 66
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN OR calculated or measured creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 71
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to the institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 67
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above 1.5 x institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 61
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to the upper limit of institutional normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 82
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min within 28 days prior to administration of therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 83
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL OR calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 45 mL/min as calculated by the Cockroft-Gault method OR 24-hour measured urine creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 45 mL/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 78
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 79
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min within 28 days prior to administration of therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 81
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 45 mL/min (24 hour urine creatinine clearance or calculated by Cockroft-Gualt equation)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 75
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than 50 mL/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 84
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 45 mL/min (24 hour urine creatinine clearance or calculated by Cockroft-Gualt equation)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 77
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance (CrCl) greater than 50 mL/min using Cockroft-Gault equation or 24-hour urine sampling?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 85
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance greater than 70mL/min/1.73m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 76
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 by Cockcroft-Gault or creatinine less than 1.5 x upper limit of normal, within 2 weeks of randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 80
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 20 mL/min/1.73m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 88
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance by MDRD (CrCl) greater than or equal to 60 ml/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 95
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN OR calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 45 mL/min as calculated by the Cockroft-Gault method OR 24-hour measured urine creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 45 mL/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 98
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 51 mL/min/1.73m2 by Cockcroft-Gault?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 96
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m2 by Cockcroft-Gault?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 100
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m2 by Cockcroft-Gault?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 101
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study GFR greater than 30 ml/min per modified Cockgroft-Gault formula?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 94
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study GFR greater than 20 ml/min per modified Cockgroft-Gault formula?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 89
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5x institutional upper limit of normal OR if creatinine greater than 1.5x ULN then is creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 40 mL/min/1.73 m2 as calculated by Cockcroft and Gault equation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 92
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL x ULN OR calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 45 mL/min as calculated by the Cockroft-Gault method OR 24-hour measured urine creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 45 mL/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 99
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal 1.5 x upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m^2 for patients with creatinine levels above 1.5 x institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 102
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 40 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 93
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance (CrCl) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min as calculated by the Cockcroft-Gault method?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 97
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than 1.5 X institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min for patients with creatinine levels greater than or equal to 1.5 X institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 104
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 90
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 51 ml/min as defined by Cockcroft-Gault equation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 91
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN, or measured creatinine clearance (CrCl) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min as calculated by the Cockcroft-Gault method (confirmation of creatinine clearance is only required when creatinine is greater than 1.5 x institutional ULN)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 87
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 by Cockroft-Gault ?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 109
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study measured creatinine clearance (CL) greater than 40 mL/min OR calculated creatinine clearance (CL) greater than 40 mL/min as determined by Cockcroft-Gault formula or by 24-hour urine collection for determination of creatinine clearance?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 110
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is screening visit creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73m2 by Cockcroft-Gault?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 105
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to institutional ULN OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 40 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 107
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 51 mL/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 106
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than 2 x the institutional ULN OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) less than or equal to 30 mL/min, as assessed using the standard methodology at the investigating center (e.g. Cockcroft-Gault, MDRD or CKD-EPI formula, EDTA clearance or 24-hour urine collection)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 103
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than 51 mL/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 111
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than 2 x normal institutional limits OR eGFR greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal (calculated via the MDRD equation)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 114
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL to receive weekly cisplatin or if serum creatinine is between 1.5 and 1.9 mg/dL, patients can receive cisplatin if the estimated creatinine clearance (CCr) is greater than 30 ml/min (for the purpose of estimating the CCr, the formula of Cockcroft and Gault for females should be used)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 113
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does pre-study creatinine not exceed the institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m^2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 115
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 2 times the upper limit of institutional normal (ULN) OR creatinine clearance GFR greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73 m2, unless thought to be related to the underlying disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Test 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 118
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 45 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 121
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional ULN OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 119
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min (if serum creatinine is not less than or equal to institutional ULN)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 116
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine within normal institutional limits OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 45 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 122
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 45 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 117
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study GFR greater than or equal to 60 ml/min/1.73 m2 unless data exists supporting safe use at lower kidney function value, no lower than 30 ml/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 127
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance within normal limits for the laboratory OR estimated glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 appropriate to race for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 129
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance within normal limits for the laboratory OR estimated glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 appropriate to race for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 124
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 3 x ULN, or if patient has creatinine level above 3 x ULN has study PI been consulted?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 123
ReferenceDocuments.description: For adults greater than or equal to 18 years, is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional ULN OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 130
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to institutional ULN OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 unless data exists supporting safe use at lower kidney function values?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 128
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is measured or calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 132
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to  40mL/min or calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 40 ml/min by the Cockcroft and Gault formula or by  24 hour urine collection for determination of creatinine clearance, using the formula noted in the protocol for males and females?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 125
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the pediatric pre-study serum creatinine result for both males and females age 10 to less than 13 years, 1.2 mg/dl; age 13 to less than 16 years, 1.5 mg/dl for males and 1.4mg/dl for females and patients greater than or equal to 16 years, 1.7 mg/dl for males and 1.4 mg/dl for females?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 120
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine within ULN OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 30 mL/min (if using the Cockcroft-Gault formula)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 112
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 2.0 mg/dL OR calculated creatinine clearance (CrCl) greater than or equal to 30 mL/min (if using the Cockcroft-Gault formula)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 137
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to institutional ULN OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2, unless data exists supporting safe use at lower kidney function values, no lower than 30 mL/min/1.73m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 136
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance, estimated using the Cockcroft-Gault equation or based on a 24 hour urine test, greater than or equal to 51 mL/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 134
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min (measured by either 24-hour urine collection or calculated using the Cockcroft-Gault formula)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 135
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal OR is measured or calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min for patients with creatinine levels greater than 1.5 X institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 139
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance less than or equal to 1.5 mg/dL OR calculated creatinine greater than or equal to 30 mL/min (if using the Cockcroft-Gault formula)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 143
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 144
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min for patients with creatinine levels greater than 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 108
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional ULN OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above 1.5 x institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 149
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min (using the CKD-epi equation)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 138
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than 30 ml/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 86
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance (estimated using the actual body weight and  Cockcroft-Gault equation) greater than or equal to 51 mL/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 145
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.1 mg/dL OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 45 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above 1.1 mg/dL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Thradex - 138
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than 30 ml/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 147
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to the institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m2 (using the Cockcroft-Gault formula)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 146
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional ULN OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 40 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 131
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than 176 mcmol/L (2 mg/dL) OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min based on the Cockcroft-Gault equation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 148
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional ULN OR measured/ calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 133
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance greater than 40 ml/min by the Cockcroft and Gault formula?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 150
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN or if elevated, is creatinine clearance (CrCl) greater than or equal to 51 mL/min as calculated by the Cockcroft-Gault method or based on a 24-hour urine test (within 7 days of study drug initiation)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 152
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN) OR Measured or calculated creatinine clearance (CrCl) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min for subject with creatinine levels greater than 1.5 x institutional ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 154
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional ULN OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min for patients with creatinine levels greater than 1.5 x institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 41
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine within normal institutional limits for age OR Calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 45 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 153
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.3 mg/dL OR is glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 40 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 155
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine  within reference laboratory ranges OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m2 (by the Cockcroft Gault equation, with normalization to the patient's body surface area)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 156
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal or is pre-study glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 45 mL/min/1.73m^2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 158
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 20 mL/min/1.73m2 by Cockroft-Gault?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 159
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional ULN OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL /min/1.73 m2 unless data exists supporting safe use at lower kidney function values, no lower than 30 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 160
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre study creatinine clearance or radioisotope GFR greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 OR is serum creatinine based on age/gender as per table in section 3.3.7.2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 163
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5X institutional upper limit of normal OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 161
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50 mL/min (if using the Cockcroft-Gault formula)?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5X institutional upper limit of normal OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 169
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is estimated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 51 mL/min using the Cockcroft-Gault equation or based on a 24 hour urine test?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 168
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance or radioisotope GFR greater than or equal to 60ml/min/1.73 m2 or a normal serum creatinine within 14 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 157
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to the institutional upper limit of normal OR is the glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 ml/min/1.73m2 by the Cockcroft-Gault equation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 170
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre -study creatinine less than or equal to 2.0 mg/dL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 165
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine, obtained within 14 days prior to randomization/enrollment, less than or equal to 1.5 × institutional ULN OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 51 mL/min/1.73 m2 unless data exists supporting safe use at lower kidney function values, no lower than 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 (using the Cockcroft-Gault Equation see Appendix B)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 166
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than the maximum amount specified in protocol for patient's age or is creatinine clearance or glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 167
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.7 mg/dl OR is the glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 50 ml/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 171
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 2 X institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 49
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance (CrCl) greater than or equal to 30 mL/min using Cockcroft-Gault equation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 162
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance CrCl greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73m2 unless data exists supporting safe use at lower kidney function values, no lower than 30 mL/min/1.73m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 175
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is less than 18 years of age, does the pre-study creatinine meet the threshold (for age and gender) in section 3.1.6 of protocol or if creatinine exceeds this threshold is a confirmation of GFR greater than or equal to 40 as determined by either 24-hour urine collection or with radioisotope based nuclear medicine evaluation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 174
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional ULN OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 (calculated by Cockcroft-Gault method) for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 172
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to institutional ULN OR glomerular filtration rate (GFR) is greater than or equal to 70 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 173
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine less than or equal to 2 X institutional upper limit of normal OR creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73m2 by Cockcroft-Gault?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 151
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal OR measured or calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min for patients with creatinine levels greater than 1.5 x above institutional normal, within 3 days prior to the first day of 7+3?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 177
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min/1.73m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 176
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 60 mL/min based on the calculated CKD-EPI glomerular filtration rate estimation for adults or 60 mL/min/1.73m2 for patients 12-17 years as calculated based on bedside Schwartz formula?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 180
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min using Cockcroft-Gault equation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 183
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x the institutional upper limit of normal or glomerular filtration rate (GFR) greater than or equal to 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 (using the Cockcroft-Gault equation, see Appendix B)?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study creatinine clearance (eGFR) greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m2

ReferenceDocuments.description: Is creatinine clearance greater than 60 mL/min/1.73 m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 186

ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum creatinine less than or equal to 3 x upper limit of normal (ULN)?
